items.sentence: Tom and Mary apparently both lived in Boston.
I can safely say that Tom will win this time.
I don\'t see what you two are so happy about.
Tom shouldn\'t tell Mary about what happened.
Tom didn\'t tell me why he\'d gone to Boston.
I don\'t think Tom is as handsome as John is.
I\'d like to speak to Tom alone for a moment.
I think that it doesn\'t make any difference.
I thought that Tom wasn\'t likely to do that.
I thought that we weren\'t talking about Tom.
We had no idea that Tom was going to do that.
Tom told me he thought I was wasting my time.
Tom told me he was going to Boston next week.
Tom told me that I should consider resigning.
Tom introduced himself as Mary\'s ex-husband.
Tom was willing to do that, but Mary wasn\'t.
Tom just walked away without saying anything.
I suspect Tom didn\'t go to Boston last week.
I suspect Tom didn\'t really need to do that.
I suspect Tom didn\'t really want to do that.
